lcIntro.p: Because young ducklings grow rapidly, they should have adequate floor, feeder, and waterer space.

lcInstruction.p: For the first three weeks, allow 2 square foot of space per duckling on wire and 1 square foot per duckling on litter.
If confinement rearing is practiced, increase the floor space to 2.5 square feet per duckling through 7 weeks of age.
Ducks should be given at least 1.5 linear inches of feeder space and 0.5 linear inches of waterer space per duckling at all times.
Larger ducks such as the Muscovy may require some additional space.
